=

e service will eventually have an Xforms interface to describe the

 URI template won't do, because the number of days in February

ic.  But, that doesn't mean a client of the API is required

component (charger) isn't required to

rg,

rger knows what resource to request from wiski.org remains opaque

en.wi=
ski.org?  If it's getting this URI from wiski.org, then asking

ranslate it, then the layered-system constraint is broken

 coupled rather tightly.

charger told it so,

For charger to
pass this on to the client, would be to induce the coupling =

ak if wiski.org changes its URI template,

ies -- why make charger responsible

o 301-redirect all old charger

s have charger start

te.

Please tell me you see how this is coupling, and a bad thing.  If

ger obeys the layered-system constraint, as it does now, then none

RIs minted by charger in the past break, if wiski.org changes

ate.  The client is only interacting with charger, so

exposing the URIs of another layer.

It doesn't really matter if the fronte=
nd or the backend or some other

ge to a backend URI format

e URIs are opaque to the client, in that the client doesn't

iski.org URIs as such, but the URIs still _break_ don't
they?  You can't si=
destep this coupling by declaring broken URIs opaque.

No REST constraint i=
s being broken by having charger proxy wiski.org,

 to common problems of Web development.  Don't

ads you to conclude that setting up simple
